item.title: Building Graphical Command Line Apps
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: It is not uncommon for people to think of the command line as an ancient, impenetrable and impossible interface to get any real work done. Even if you are a veteran vim user, the thought of actually creating anything other than a single line, argument based interface will probably seem like something out of reach […]
item.content:encoded: It is not uncommon for people to think of the command line as an ancient, impenetrable and impossible interface to get any real work done. Even if you are a veteran vim user, the thought of actually creating anything other than a single line, argument based interface will probably seem like something out of reach for almost anyone. Not so! Using nothing but JavaScript, you can create rich, compelling, command line interfaces that leverage keyboard and mouse input, and more!

item.title: Modern Websites for the Modern Web
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: It seems like new APIs for the web are released every week. It would be cool to be able to use them, but if you need to make websites for the average user, you won’t be able to use them for years – right? Wrong. Patrick Kettner, the lead developer on Modernizr and PM for […]
item.content:encoded: It seems like new APIs for the web are released every week. It would be cool to be able to use them, but if you need to make websites for the average user, you won’t be able to use them for years – right? Wrong. Patrick Kettner, the lead developer on Modernizr and PM for Microsoft Edge, will go over how creating feature rich and super fast front end applications, integrating over a dozen cutting edge web features, all while supporting even the oldest of web clients. If you want to see a 100% clientside offline enabled application work in every browser to Mosiac, and even be ported to a command line GUI (yes GUI), come check it out!
